intro: Alepidea insculpta, commonly known as the serrated leaved daisies, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, serrated leaves and produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It is typically found in rocky and sandy soils, thriving in coastal and mountainous regions. Alepidea insculpta is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
